means: 群集，成群结队而行( flock的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: The Thames was in spate, with flocks of Canada geese speeding downriver.
sentence.Network_cn: 泰晤士河河水暴涨，成群的加拿大雁迅速游向下游。

sentence.Network_en: Vistors came in flocks to see the new bridge.
sentence.Network_cn: 参观者成群结队地来观看这座新桥.

sentence.Network_en: They move with their flocks to upland pastures.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们带着牲畜迁往高原上的牧场.

entry.def: A flock of birds, sheep, or goats is a group of them.

example.ex: They kept a small flock of sheep...
They are gregarious birds and feed in flocks.
example.tran: 它们是群居鸟类，会集群觅食。

entry.def: You can refer to a group of people or things as a flock of them to emphasize that there are a lot of them.

example.ex: These cases all attracted flocks of famous writers.
example.tran: 这些案件都吸引了大批知名作家的关注。

entry.def: If people flock to a particular place or event, a very large number of them go there, usually because it is pleasant or interesting.

example.ex: The public have flocked to the show...
example.tran: 公众蜂拥而至观看演出。

example.ex: The criticisms will not stop people flocking to see the film...
example.tran: 批评的声音不会阻止人们涌到影院观看这部电影。

entry.tran: (到牧师所在教堂做礼拜或属于其辖区的)全体教徒，教众群体
entry.def: A clergyman's flock is the group of Christians who come to his church or live in the area that he has responsibility for.

auth_sentence.content: I will never care three flocks for his ambition.

auth_sentence.content: They look white, like flocks of wooll.

auth_sentence.content: Their social nature results in cacophonies of song amongst flocks.
